definition: When you enter a country, enquire about the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do

border/place/condition/boundary/circumstances/territory
to ask
custom/convention/popular/common/coarse/vulgar/secular
to travel a thousand miles beats reading a thousand books

definition: to act according to the situation (idiom)

to adhere strictly (to the rules)
to follow the trend
to adapt to circumstances
know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
to know the enemy and know oneself (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees

keenly observant of trivial details
knowledgeable and versatile
to personally undertake or manage
